summary: phage library consists of billions of heterologous peptides that can be produced by the fusion of random nucleic acid sequences to the N terminus of one of the capsid protein genes of a filamentous bacteriophage. this technology has been applied successfully in numerous aspects, including antibody engineering [10], peptide discovery and manufacture [11], diagnostic analysis [12] and used as primary antibody. 3 ml of the viruses were subjected to viral RNA extraction using a RNA extraction kit (Fastgene, China) the reverse transcription system included 5 l of viral RNA (1 g), 7.5 l of sterile water, 1 l of M-MLV reverse transcriptase. the reaction was performed at 42°C for 30 min, 99°C for 5 min and 5°C for 5 min. specificities of selected phages were evaluated by using them as diagnostic reagents. these viruses included duck plague virus (DPV) a vaccine strain, avian bronchitis virus (IBV) strain Beaudette, fowlpox virus (FPV) isolate HH2008, avian infectious bursal phages in input, elute buffer and that after amplification in E.coli were determined to evaluate the enrichment efficiency. ELISA plates were coated with H5N1 viruses diluted in 0.1 M NaHCO3 (pH8.6) at a concentration of 10 g/well. the color was developed using o-phenylenediamine (OPD) and the optical density (OD) value was read using an ELISA plate reader at a wavelength of 405 nm. each phage clone DNA was purified using a plasmid extraction kit (Qiagen, Germany) the OD405 value of detected phage wells (P)/negative control (N)>2 was judged as positive results. for conventional ELISA, the H5N1 viruses were serially diluted in DMEM medium. after triple washes with TBST, the wells were incubated with HRP-conjugated secondary antibody for 1 h. reaction was performed at 42°C for 30 min, 99°C for 5 min and 5°C for 5 min. cDNA was serially diluted and subjected to PCR. authenticity of the PCR product was confirmed by sequencing. castle disease virus (NDV) strain La Sota was coated in 0.1 M NaHCO3 (pH8.6) on ELISA plates overnight at 4°C. at least three independent experiments were carried out, each data point was presented as mean SD. the phage display technology has become an increasingly attractive molecular tool to researchers in biotechnology related fields [17]–[19]. the phage display technology has antibodies specific to the HA of H5N1 virus have also been characterized. this is the first time to report the peptide sequences that can bind to the HPAI H5N1 viruses. further experiments are needed to analyze the function of the peptides/motifs in the context of H5N1 infection. the minimum quantity of the H5N1 viruses for phages 1 to 3 was 0.1 g, 0.5 g and 0.8 g respectively. the phage 1 was the most sensitive reagent used in the phage-based ELISA. the minimum quantity of H5N1 viruses required for the ELISA was determined as 0.3 g. the experiment was performed in triplicate and the P/N value was from three independent assays. the concentration of the viruses is indicated in the x axis. the avian viruses selected in this study are very common in china. the three identified phages were capable of recognizing H5N1 viruses specifically rather than other control viruses (p0.01) at the same time, the low reactivity of the control, the phage complex from the phage library to the targets in the ELISA excluded any artifact clearly. the viruses were diluted in 0.1 M NaHCO3 (pH8.6) to a final concentration of 15 g/well in ELISA plates followed by incubation with phages 1–3, anti-M13 antibody and HRP-conjugated secondary antibody. the name and OD405 value of individual phage are indicated in x and y axis, respectively. ltamivir appears to be very time dependant, where treatment started later than 24 hours post infection is much less effective. influenza viruses undergo antigenic drift and antigenic shift, resulting in new virus strains that may not be recognized by earlier influenza strains. effective diagnostic tests for viruses screening prior to application of drugs and vaccines are widely accepted. ten phage clones that specific binding to H5N1 viruses were identified. no positive results were found in the control, confirming binding specificity of the phages to the H5N1 viruses. the individual phage and controls are indicated in the x axis. the role of the identified peptides/motifs in H5N1 virus infection needs to be investigated in the future. this is the first time to report the peptide sequences that can bind to the HPAI H5N1 viruses. age 5 Lane 1: DNA marker; Lane 1, PCR product from undiluted cDNA; Lanes 2–4 were PCR products of 10-fold serially diluted cDNA. phages harboring specific peptides recognizing the H5N1 viruses were incubated with duck plague virus (DPV), avian bronchitis virus (IBV), fowlpox virus (FPV), avian infectious bursal disease virus (IBDV), H5N1 virus, avian infectious laryngotracheitis virus (AILV) and newcastle disease virus. the name and OD405 value of individual phage are indicated in x and y axis. the experiment was performed in triplicate.
